Posted By: GengilOrbios (10/16/2010 4:13:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Pert: "Owner" is a game term defined in the rules. From the comprehensive rules:  
  
"The owner of a card in the game is the player who started the game with it in his or her deck. If a  
card is brought into the game from outside the game rather than starting in a player’s deck, its  
owner is the player who brought it into the game. If a card starts the game in the command zone, its  
owner is the player who put it into the command zone to start the game. **Legal ownership of a card  
in the game is irrelevant to the game rules except for the rules for ante.**"
posts.html:
Pert: "Owner" is a game term defined in the rules. From the comprehensive rules:

"The owner of a card in the game is the player who started the game with it in his or her deck. If a
card is brought into the game from outside the game rather than starting in a player’s deck, its
owner is the player who brought it into the game. If a card starts the game in the command zone, its
owner is the player who put it into the command zone to start the game. Legal ownership of a card
in the game is irrelevant to the game rules except for the rules for ante."

posts.post_content: Before the ownership rule changed, I wanted to build a deck where I gave someone some creature tokens (which I owned) using a Ravnica [hunted creature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=83573) and then [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=153973) my Bronze Bombshell. It would've been very slow and impractical but also funny as hell. I was excited about [Endless Whispers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=50129) until I noticed that the creature doesn't come back until end of turn (not immediately).
posts.html:
